protocol.description: The aim of this color management extension is to get HDR games working quickly, and have an easy way to test implementations in the wild before the upstream protocol is ready to be merged. For that purpose it's intentionally limited and cut down and does not serve all uses cases.

interface.name: frog_color_management_factory_v1
interface.description: The color management factory singleton creates color managed surface objects.

description.summary: create color management interface for surface

interface.name: frog_color_managed_surface
interface.description:
Interface for changing surface color management and HDR state.
An implementation must: support every part of the version of the frog_color_managed_surface interface it exposes. Including all known enums associated with a given version.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroying the color managed surface resets all known color state for the surface back to 'undefined' implementation-specific values.

enum.name: transfer_function
enum.description:
Extended information on the transfer functions described here can be found in the Khronos Data Format specification:
https://registry.khronos.org/DataFormat/specs/1.3/dataformat.1.3.html

entry.name: undefined
entry.summary: specifies undefined, implementation-specific handling of the surface's transfer function.

entry.name: srgb
entry.summary: specifies the sRGB non-linear EOTF. An implementation may: display this as Gamma 2.2 for the purposes of being consistent with content rendering across displays, rendering_intent and user expectations.

entry.name: gamma_22
entry.summary: specifies gamma 2.2 power curve as the EOTF

entry.name: st2084_pq
entry.summary: specifies the SMPTE ST2084 Perceptual Quantizer (PQ) EOTF

entry.name: scrgb_linear
entry.summary: specifies the scRGB (extended sRGB) linear EOTF. Note: Primaries outside the gamut triangle specified can be expressed with negative values for this transfer function.

description.summary: sets a known transfer function for a surface

entry.name: rec709
entry.summary: specifies Rec.709/sRGB primaries with D65 white point

entry.name: rec2020
entry.summary: specifies Rec.2020/HDR10 primaries with D65 white point

description.summary: sets the container color volume (primaries) for a surface

enum.name: render_intent
enum.description:
Extended information on render intents described here can be found in ICC.1:2022:
https://www.color.org/specification/ICC.1-2022-05.pdf

request.name: set_render_intent

description.summary: sets the render intent for a surface

request.description: NOTE: On a surface with "perceptual" (default) render intent, handling of the container's color volume is implementation-specific, and may differ between different transfer functions it is paired with: ie. sRGB + 709 rendering may have it's primaries widened to more of the available display's gamut to be be more pleasing for the viewer. Compared to scRGB Linear + 709 being treated faithfully as 709 (including utilizing negatives out of the 709 gamut triangle)

request.name: set_hdr_metadata

description.summary: set HDR metadata for a surface

request.description:
Forwards HDR metadata from the client to the compositor.
HDR Metadata Infoframe as per CTA 861.G spec.
Usage of this HDR metadata is implementation specific and outside of the scope of this protocol.

event.name: preferred_metadata
event.description:
Current preferred metadata for a surface. The application should use this information to tone-map its buffers to this target before committing.
This metadata does not necessarily correspond to any physical output, but rather what the compositor thinks would be best for a given surface.

arg.name: transfer_function
arg.description: Specifies a known transfer function that corresponds to the output the surface is targeting.

arg.name: max_luminance
arg.description:
Max Output Luminance The max luminance in nits that the output is capable of rendering in small areas. Content should: not exceed this value to avoid clipping.
This value is coded as an unsigned 16-bit value in units of 1 cd/m2, where 0x0001 represents 1 cd/m2 and 0xFFFF represents 65535 cd/m2.

arg.name: min_luminance
arg.description:
Min Output Luminance The min luminance that the output is capable of rendering. Content should: not exceed this value to avoid clipping.
This value is coded as an unsigned 16-bit value in units of 0.0001 cd/m2, where 0x0001 represents 0.0001 cd/m2 and 0xFFFF represents 6.5535 cd/m2.

arg.name: max_full_frame_luminance
arg.description:
Max Full Frame Luminance The max luminance in nits that the output is capable of rendering for the full frame sustained.
This value is coded as an unsigned 16-bit value in units of 1 cd/m2, where 0x0001 represents 1 cd/m2 and 0xFFFF represents 65535 cd/m2.
